segment.source: WinPE: Mount and Customize
segment.target: WinPE: Mount and Customize

segment.source: WinPE: Mount and Customize
segment.target: WinPE: Mount and Customize

segment.source: WinPE: Mount and Customize
segment.target: WinPE: Mount and Customize

segment.source: Add drivers to Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE), such as graphics drivers or network drivers.
segment.target: Add drivers to Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE), such as graphics drivers or network drivers.

segment.source: Common customizations:
segment.target: Common customizations:

segment.source: Add device drivers (.inf files).
segment.target: Add device drivers (.inf files).

segment.source: You can customize device drivers, such as drivers that support network cards or storage devices.
segment.target: You can customize device drivers, such as drivers that support network cards or storage devices.

segment.source: Add packages (.cab files, also known as WinPE optional components) Add languages, hotfixes, or support for features like PowerShell and the HTML Application Language (HTA).
segment.target: Add packages (.cab files, also known as WinPE optional components) Add languages, hotfixes, or support for features like PowerShell and the HTML Application Language (HTA).

segment.source: Add a language.
segment.target: Add a language.

segment.source: To run WinPE in multiple languages, add the packages (optional components) for those languages.
segment.target: To run WinPE in multiple languages, add the packages (optional components) for those languages.

segment.source: Add files and folders.
segment.target: Add files and folders.

segment.source: These can be added directly to the WinPE image.
segment.target: These can be added directly to the WinPE image.

segment.source: Add a newer version of DISM.
segment.target: Add a newer version of DISM.

segment.source: When new versions of Windows require features from the latest version of DISM, you can add DISM directly into WinPE.
segment.target: When new versions of Windows require features from the latest version of DISM, you can add DISM directly into WinPE.

segment.source: Add a startup script.
segment.target: Add a startup script.

segment.source: Examples include setting up a network connection, or adding a custom application, such as diagnostic software.
segment.target: Examples include setting up a network connection, or adding a custom application, such as diagnostic software.

segment.source: Add an app.
segment.target: Add an app.

segment.source: Note, WinPE only supports legacy apps.
segment.target: Note, WinPE only supports legacy apps.

segment.source: Add temporary storage (scratch space).
segment.target: Add temporary storage (scratch space).

segment.source: If your application requires temporary file storage, you can reserve extra memory space in RAM.
segment.target: If your application requires temporary file storage, you can reserve extra memory space in RAM.

segment.source: Replace the background image
segment.target: Replace the background image

segment.source: Add answer file settings
segment.target: Add answer file settings

segment.source: Get the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit with Windows PE tools
segment.target: Get the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit with Windows PE tools

segment.source: Install the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) Technical Reference, including the Windows PE feature.
segment.target: Install the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) Technical Reference, including the Windows PE feature.

segment.source: Create a set of either 32-bit or 64-bit Windows PE files
segment.target: Create a set of either 32-bit or 64-bit Windows PE files

segment.source: Click Start, and type deployment.
segment.target: Click Start, and type deployment.

segment.source: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and then select Run as administrator.
segment.target: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and then select Run as administrator.

segment.source: In the Deployment Tools and Imaging Environment, copy the WinPE files for the PCs you want to boot.
segment.target: In the Deployment Tools and Imaging Environment, copy the WinPE files for the PCs you want to boot.

segment.source: The 64-bit version can boot 64-bit UEFI and 64-bit BIOS PCs.
segment.target: The 64-bit version can boot 64-bit UEFI and 64-bit BIOS PCs.

segment.source: The 32-bit version of WinPE can boot 32-bit UEFI, 32-bit BIOS, and 64-bit BIOS PCs.
segment.target: The 32-bit version of WinPE can boot 32-bit UEFI, 32-bit BIOS, and 64-bit BIOS PCs.

segment.source: Mount the Windows PE boot image
segment.target: Mount the Windows PE boot image

segment.source: Mount the WinPE image.
segment.target: Mount the WinPE image.

segment.source: Add customizations
segment.target: Add customizations

segment.source: Add device drivers (.inf files)
segment.target: Add device drivers (.inf files)

segment.source: Add the device driver to the WinPE image.
segment.target: Add the device driver to the WinPE image.

segment.source: Although you can add multiple drivers to an image by using one command, it is often easier to troubleshoot problems by adding each driver package individually.
segment.target: Although you can add multiple drivers to an image by using one command, it is often easier to troubleshoot problems by adding each driver package individually.

segment.source: To learn more about drivers, see Add device drivers (.inf files).
segment.target: To learn more about drivers, see Add device drivers (.inf files).

segment.source: Add packages/languages/optional components/.cab files
segment.target: Add packages/languages/optional components/.cab files

segment.source: Add the optional component into WinPE.
segment.target: Add the optional component into WinPE.

segment.source: To add optional components, you need to add both the optional component and its associated language packs.
segment.target: To add optional components, you need to add both the optional component and its associated language packs.

segment.source: To learn more about adding packages, see WinPE: Add packages (Optional Components Reference).
segment.target: To learn more about adding packages, see WinPE: Add packages (Optional Components Reference).

segment.source: Add files and folders
segment.target: Add files and folders

segment.source: Copy files and folders into the C:WinPEamd64mount folder.
segment.target: Copy files and folders into the C:WinPEamd64mount folder.

segment.source: These files will show up in the X: folder in WinPE.
segment.target: These files will show up in the X: folder in WinPE.

segment.source: Don't add too many files, as these will slow down WinPE and can fill up the available memory in the default RAMDisk environment.
segment.target: Don't add too many files, as these will slow down WinPE and can fill up the available memory in the default RAMDisk environment.

segment.source: Add a startup script
segment.target: Add a startup script

segment.source: Modify the Startnet.cmd script to include your customized commands.
segment.target: Modify the Startnet.cmd script to include your customized commands.

segment.source: This file is located at .
segment.target: This file is located at .

segment.source: You can also call other batch files or command line scripts from this file.
segment.target: You can also call other batch files or command line scripts from this file.

segment.source: For Plug and Play or networking support, make sure that you include a call to wpeinit in your customized Startnet.cmd script.
segment.target: For Plug and Play or networking support, make sure that you include a call to wpeinit in your customized Startnet.cmd script.

segment.source: For more info, see Wpeinit and Startnet.cmd: Using WinPE Startup Scripts.
segment.target: For more info, see Wpeinit and Startnet.cmd: Using WinPE Startup Scripts.

segment.source: Add an app
segment.target: Add an app

segment.source: Create an app directory inside the mounted WinPE image.
segment.target: Create an app directory inside the mounted WinPE image.

segment.source: Copy the necessary app files to the local WinPE directory.
segment.target: Copy the necessary app files to the local WinPE directory.

segment.source: Test the app later by booting WinPE and running the application from the X: directory.
segment.target: Test the app later by booting WinPE and running the application from the X: directory.

segment.source: If your app requires temporary storage, or if WinPE becomes unresponsive when it runs an app, you may need to increase the amount of temporary storage (scratch space) allocated to WinPE.
segment.target: If your app requires temporary storage, or if WinPE becomes unresponsive when it runs an app, you may need to increase the amount of temporary storage (scratch space) allocated to WinPE.

segment.source: To automatically launch a shell or application that runs when WinPE starts, add the path location to the Winpeshl.ini file.
segment.target: To automatically launch a shell or application that runs when WinPE starts, add the path location to the Winpeshl.ini file.

segment.source: For more info, see Winpeshl.ini Reference: Launching an app when WinPE starts.
segment.target: For more info, see Winpeshl.ini Reference: Launching an app when WinPE starts.

segment.source: Add temporary storage (scratch space)
segment.target: Add temporary storage (scratch space)

segment.source: WinPE reserves memory on the X: drive to unpack the WinPE files, plus additional temporary file storage, known as scratch space, that can be used by your applications.
segment.target: WinPE reserves memory on the X: drive to unpack the WinPE files, plus additional temporary file storage, known as scratch space, that can be used by your applications.

segment.source: By default, this is 512MB for PCs with more than 1GB of RAM, otherwise the default is 32MB.
segment.target: By default, this is 512MB for PCs with more than 1GB of RAM, otherwise the default is 32MB.

segment.source: Valid values are 32, 64, 128, 256, or 512.
segment.target: Valid values are 32, 64, 128, 256, or 512.

segment.source: Replace the background image
segment.target: Replace the background image

segment.source: If you've got multiple versions of WinPE, you can set the background image so you can instantly tell which version of WinPE is running.
segment.target: If you've got multiple versions of WinPE, you can set the background image so you can instantly tell which version of WinPE is running.

segment.source: Change the security permissions of the WinPE background image file ().
segment.target: Change the security permissions of the WinPE background image file ().

segment.source: This allows you to modify or delete the file.
segment.target: This allows you to modify or delete the file.

segment.source: In Windows Explorer, navigate to .
segment.target: In Windows Explorer, navigate to .

segment.source: Right-click the file, and select PropertiesSecurity tab Advanced.
segment.target: Right-click the file, and select PropertiesSecurity tab Advanced.

segment.source: Next to Owner, select Change.
segment.target: Next to Owner, select Change.

segment.source: Change the owner to Administrators.
segment.target: Change the owner to Administrators.

segment.source: Apply the changes, and exit the Properties window to save changes.
segment.target: Apply the changes, and exit the Properties window to save changes.

segment.source: Right-click the file, and select PropertiesSecurity tab Advanced.
segment.target: Right-click the file, and select PropertiesSecurity tab Advanced.

segment.source: Modify the permissions for Administrators to allow full access.
segment.target: Modify the permissions for Administrators to allow full access.

segment.source: Apply the changes, and exit the Properties window to save changes.
segment.target: Apply the changes, and exit the Properties window to save changes.

segment.source: Replace the file with your own image file.
segment.target: Replace the file with your own image file.

segment.source: Add answer file settings
segment.target: Add answer file settings

segment.source: Some WinPE settings can be managed by using an answer file, such as firewall, network, and display settings.
segment.target: Some WinPE settings can be managed by using an answer file, such as firewall, network, and display settings.

segment.source: Create an answer file, name it unattend.xml, and add it to the root of the WinPE media to process these settings.
segment.target: Create an answer file, name it unattend.xml, and add it to the root of the WinPE media to process these settings.

segment.source: For more information, see Wpeinit and Startnet.cmd: Using WinPE Startup Scripts.
segment.target: For more information, see Wpeinit and Startnet.cmd: Using WinPE Startup Scripts.

segment.source: Unmount the Windows PE image and create media
segment.target: Unmount the Windows PE image and create media

segment.source: Unmount the WinPE image.
segment.target: Unmount the WinPE image.

segment.source: Create bootable media, such as a USB flash drive.
segment.target: Create bootable media, such as a USB flash drive.

segment.source: Boot the media.
segment.target: Boot the media.

segment.source: WinPE starts automatically.
segment.target: WinPE starts automatically.

segment.source: After the WinPE window appears, the wpeinit command runs automatically.
segment.target: After the WinPE window appears, the wpeinit command runs automatically.

segment.source: This may take a few minutes.
segment.target: This may take a few minutes.

segment.source: Verify your customizations.
segment.target: Verify your customizations.

segment.source: Troubleshooting
segment.target: Troubleshooting

segment.source: WinPE won’t boot?
segment.target: WinPE won’t boot?

segment.source: See the troubleshooting tips at the end of the topic: WinPE: Create USB Bootable drive
segment.target: See the troubleshooting tips at the end of the topic: WinPE: Create USB Bootable drive

segment.source: For tips on connecting to a network, see WinPE Network Drivers: Initializing and adding drivers.
segment.target: For tips on connecting to a network, see WinPE Network Drivers: Initializing and adding drivers.

segment.source: If the WinPE image becomes unserviceable, you may need to clean up the images before you can mount the image again.
segment.target: If the WinPE image becomes unserviceable, you may need to clean up the images before you can mount the image again.

segment.source: For information, see Repair a Windows Image.
segment.target: For information, see Repair a Windows Image.

segment.source: To delete a working directory:
segment.target: To delete a working directory:

segment.source: In some cases, you may not be able to recover the mounted image.
segment.target: In some cases, you may not be able to recover the mounted image.

segment.source: DISM protects you from accidentally deleting the working directory, so you may have to try the following steps to get access to delete the mounted directory.
segment.target: DISM protects you from accidentally deleting the working directory, so you may have to try the following steps to get access to delete the mounted directory.

segment.source: Try each of the following steps:
segment.target: Try each of the following steps:

segment.source: Try remounting the image:
segment.target: Try remounting the image:

segment.source: Try unmounting the image, discarding the changes:
segment.target: Try unmounting the image, discarding the changes:

segment.source: Try cleaning up the resources associated with the mounted image:
segment.target: Try cleaning up the resources associated with the mounted image:
